title: Incorrect parity style trace init code serialization in v1.25.0
body:
**Description**

Recent JSON improvements introduced in v1.25.0 broke parity-style compatibility of all `trace_*` methods for serialization of `create`/`create2` trace actions.

Prior JSON logic contained the following override to be consistent with an old parity spec - https://github.com/NethermindEth/nethermind/blob/9c1d76b5eb9de7822fdc21579f43ef47403b870e/src/Nethermind/Nethermind.JsonRpc/Modules/Trace/ParityTraceActionConverter.cs#L49-L56
New JSON logic always serializes field as `input`, however - https://github.com/NethermindEth/nethermind/blob/abbe758afb7c61e4fd2ae071056b0cab61a4ad21/src/Nethermind/Nethermind.Evm/Tracing/ParityStyle/ParityTraceActionConverter.cs#L165-L166

**Steps to Reproduce**

Trace the following transaction from the gnosis mainnet - `0x6b4a3942ce59ead2226c42397c532a6d0d0fed851c29d7dbe77fcd32a9c9852e` using either `trace_transaction` or `trace_replayTransaction` method.
Compare result with `v1.24.0` Nethermind node or with erigon node (e.g. from `https://rpc.ankr.com/gnosis`).

The diff in the response is the following:
```diff
				"action": {
					"creationMethod": "create2",
					"from": "0x4e59b44847b379578588920ca78fbf26c0b4956c",
					"gas": "0x390110",
-					"init": "0x6124fa61003a600b82828 ...,
+					"input": "0x6124fa61003a600b82828 ...,
                                        "to": "0x422d470fb02206733bb770d2a27d6d98f493af64",
					"value": "0x0"
				},
```
